VEGAN COTTAGE PIE ğŸ¥§ 

An Irish Classic, pure comfort food but made vegan! I used lentils and oh myâ€¦ it was so delicious ğŸ˜‹.

RECIPE (3-4 servings, 50min prep time)
-1 onion
-3 cloves garlic
-2 small carrots 
Fry in some oil
-2 Tbsp tomato paste
-1 Tbsp flour
Stir it in
-1 can lentils
Add it with the liquid fro  the can
-a handful frozen green peas
-1 Tsp Rosemary and thyme
-salt and pepper to taste
-2 Tbsp vegan Worcestershire sauce 
Stir everything together and spread it evenly in a pan (oven-proof dish). Turn off the heat.
Potato mash:
-800g potatoes
Chop them and cook until soft
-1/2 cup to 1 cup (125-250ml) plant milk
-2 tbsp vegan Butter
-salt to taste 
Mash until you have a creamy mash.
Spread it on the filling and make a pattern with a fork.
Optionally brush with vegan cream (helps browning in the oven)
Bake at 200C/400F for 30-35 mins (broil the last 2-3mins.

RECIPE (6 injeras)
Ersho:
-97g teff flour
-155ml water
-1 TSP instant yeast
Day 1:
Combine everything and set aside for one day.
Day 2: 
Stir in 2 TBSP teff flour and set aside for one day
Day 3:
If you live in a cold climate skip to day 4. Otherwise stir in 2 TBSp flour and 30ml water and set aside for one day.
Day 4:
Your starter is ready.
Injera batter:
-1 1/2 cups (195g) teff flour
-2 1/2 TBSP ersho 
-2 cups (500ml) water
Day 1:
Whisk to combine until itâ€™s a smooth batter and set aside for one day.
Day 2: 
Take out 1/4 cup (60ml) of the batter and heat it up until itâ€™s rubbery whilst stirring constantly. Let it cool down for 5 minutes and whisk in again. Let the batter rest 24h.
Day 3:
Heat up a non-stick pan and spread some batter like a thin crÃªpes. Cover and cook on medium high heat for 3-5 minutes until little bubbles and crackles appear.
*Always cover the batter/starter with a clean kitchen towel.
**if there should be any dark liquid at the surface, simlpy discard it.
I served it with vegan Doro wat, Misir wat, Gomem wat and Timatim (check the UT video)

VEGAN LABNEH ğŸ˜‹ with simit and a zesty-cumin oilâ€¦ğŸ™Œ

Labneh is a strained yogurt which turns into a creamy, cream cheese-like spread, itâ€™s widely spread in the Levante and can be eaten sweet and savoury.
This is my vegan version and I highly recommend enjoying it with the spicy oil and a freshly baked simit. ğŸ¤—

RECIPE

-2 Cups (500g) soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
-2 Tbsp lemon juice
-a generous pinch of salt
PUT in a thin kitchen towel placed on a strainer/REFRIGERATE for at least 6h
Spicy oil:
-1 Tbsp each lemon zest, cumin
-1/2 Tbsp Chili flakes, ground coriander
-1/4 cup (60ml) hot oil
STIR/SET aside
Simit:
-3 1/4 cup (500g) flour
-2 Tsp instant yeast
-1 cup + 3 Tbsp (300ml) lukewarm water
-1 Tbsp oil
Coating:
-1/4 cup (85g) dare or pomegranate syrup
-1/8 cup (30ml) water
-1/2 Tbsp flour
Else:
-1/2 cup (100g) sesame seeds
KNEAD the dough and let it rest 1h/MIX up the coating/DIVIDE the dough into 12pieces and roll them into strings/TWIST two strings and make a circle/DIP in coating, add sesame seeds and BAKE at 200Celsius/400Fahrenheit for 15-20mins
